title: Product Marketing Manager, Avigilon Alta Cloud
description:
Company Overview

At Motorola Solutions, we're guided by a shared purpose - helping people be their best in the moments that matter - and we live up to our purpose every day by solving for safer. Because people can only be their best when they not only feel safe, but are safe. We're solving for safer by building the best possible technologies across every part of our safety and security ecosystem. That's mission-critical communications devices and networks, AI-powered video security & access control and the ability to unite voice, video and data in a single command center view. We're solving for safer by connecting public safety agencies and enterprises, enabling the collaboration that's critical to connect those in need with those who can help. The work we do here matters.

Department Overview

The Motorola Solutions Video Security and Access Control (VS&A) group provides physical security solutions that are used by government and commercial customers around the world. From educational and healthcare to financial, retail, and government agencies, organizations depend on VS&A solutions for safety and security.

Job Description

This is a remote opportunity, and candidates are across the United States are encouraged to apply.

Motorola Solutions is seeking a Product Marketing Manager to help grow our cloud-native Avigilon Alta access control offering within the VS&A portfolio. The Avigilon Alta cloud-native access control solution is a fast, flexible and future-proof system with mobile-first technology that helps customers enhance security and improve awareness with intuitive software, modern readers, and innovative features.

As a Product Marketer, you will work across Marketing and with Product Management and Sales to develop and deliver exceptional marketing for our Avigilon Alta access control solution. You will be tasked with driving strategy and go-to-market plans, bringing new products and features to market, and promoting cloud product and service offerings. Your focus will be on crafting messaging, creating marketing assets and sales enablement materials, and supporting campaigns for customers and partners.

Who you are:

A creative storyteller with excellent communication skills that span writing, speaking and presenting. Curious. You ask questions and are open to learning new technologies, new audiences and new markets. An effective communicator, taking complex products or features and distilling them into clear, concise, value-focused messages. Creative and compelling by crafting exciting messages to differentiate your product in the market. Organized, with excellent follow-up skills, and can take ownership of projects and see them to completion. A cross-functional collaborator who can build relationships across teams to drive the greatest impact. Embracing mistakes, and the ability to learn from them and move forward. A natural problem solver, and adapt to shifting projects and moving targets. 

Day to Day Responsibilities:

Partner with Product Management to be the voice of the customerCraft messaging and positioning that demonstrates the value of your solution and differentiates it in the market. Acquire deep customer knowledge through market research, customer interviews, and segmentation analysis. Conduct competitor and market research to better understand our differentiation, target customers, key industries, and buyer personas. Create and execute go-to-market strategies to drive product awareness, adoption, and pipeline . Work with Integrated Marketing to develop and execute marketing campaigns to increase awareness and drive demand for products and solutions. Develop internal and external facing content to enable Sales to effectively position and sell Avigilon Alta. Design and execute channel marketing strategy and collateral to drive adoption, including training, tool kits, and enablement materials. Own product and feature launches, including messaging and positioning, identifying target audiences, and creating content to support the launch, such as web pages, social media, collateral, presentations, and more. 

Preferred Qualifications & Skills:

Degree concentration in marketing, business, or a related field. 5+ years of experience in Product Marketing, preferably B2BExperience working with a combined hardware/software cloud (SaaS) solution is a plus, with an emphasis on security/access control. 

The base salary range for this role is $95,000-105,000 per year.

 Legal authorization to work in the U.S. indefinitely is required. Employer work permit sponsorship is not available for this position.

Basic Requirements

Bachelors Degree3+ years of product marketing experience

Travel Requirements

10-25%

Relocation Provided

None

Position Type

Experienced

Referral Payment Plan

No

Our U.S. Benefits include:

Incentive Bonus PlansMedical, Dental, Vision benefits401K with Company Match9 Paid HolidaysGenerous Paid Time Off PackagesEmployee Stock Purchase PlanPaid Parental & Family Leaveand more!

EEO Statement

Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally-protected characteristic.

We are proud of our people-first and community-focused culture, empowering every Motorolan to be their most authentic self and to do their best work to deliver on the promise of a safer world. If you’d like to join our team but feel that you don’t quite meet all of the preferred skills, we’d still love to hear why you think you’d be a great addition to our team.

We’re committed to providing an inclusive and accessible recruiting experience for candidates with disabilities, or other physical or mental health conditions. To request an accommodation, please email ohr@motorolasolutions.com.

title: Azure Cloud Engineer III
description:
Hybrid |Perm | No sponsorship available

About Our Client

Our client is a well-established forward-thinking finance organization that utilizes cutting-edge technology. The leadership team is dedicated to employee success by embracing innovation, fostering creativity, and striving for excellence in all of their endeavors. You'll be part of a team that is dedicated to pushing boundaries, solving complex challenges, and delivering exceptional results that have a positive impact on their community. The company strongly encourages growth and professional development!

PTO:15 days + sick time

Retirement: 401K with a match

Design, deploy, and maintain robust IT systems and infrastructure using Azure cloud services to support our finance projects.Migrating on-prem servers and machines to the Azure cloud ecosystem.Responsible for all high level DevOps tasks.Ensure the stability, security, and scalability of our network infrastructure, servers, and storage systems on the Azure platform.Proactively monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and implement timely resolutions to minimize downtime.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to assess and address the IT needs of various departments, ensuring efficient and reliable operations on Azure.Implement and enforce cybersecurity measures in Azure to protect our sensitive data and intellectual property.

Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.Proven experience as a Systems Administrator or Cloud Engineer, preferably in a similar industry or engineering environment.Strong knowledge of network infrastructure, including LAN/WAN, routers, switches, firewalls, and VPN technologies.Proficiency in Azure cloud services, server administration, virtualization, and cloud-based services.Experience with Azure-specific technologies, such as Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Virtual Networks, and Azure Active Directory.Familiarity with finance industry.Solid understanding of cybersecurity principles and best practices, specifically in an Azure environment.Excellent problem-solving skills with a proactive and customer-centric approach.

We specialize in placement of IT professionals. Please contact me for more information about this role as well as other opportunities.

title: Chief Cloud Officer
description:
Chief Cloud Officer is a senior executive who is responsible for managing the day-to-day operations of a company and ensuring its overall efficiency and effectiveness. 
Operational Leadership: Chief Cloud Officer is responsible for providing strategic leadership and direction to all operational departments within the organization, including production, sales, marketing, finance, human resources, and logistics. They oversee the execution of operational plans and ensure that goals and objectives are achieved.
Process Optimization: Chief Cloud Officer identifies opportunities for process improvement and implements strategies to enhance operational efficiency. This includes streamlining workflows, eliminating bottlenecks, reducing costs, and implementing best practices to drive productivity and quality.
Performance Monitoring:Chief Cloud Officer establishes key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to measure the performance of various operational areas. They regularly monitor and analyze these metrics to assess the company's overall performance and make data-driven decisions to optimize operations.
Strategic Planning: Working closely with the CEO and other executives, the executive director participates in the development and execution of the company's strategic plans and initiatives. They provide input on operational feasibility, scalability, and resource allocation to support the company's growth objectives.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Chief Cloud Officer fosters collaboration and alignment across different departments and functions within the organization. They work closely with other senior leaders to ensure seamless coordination and integration of operational activities, promoting a unified approach to achieving organizational goals.
Risk Management Chief Cloud Officer identifies and manages operational risks and develops strategies to mitigate potential threats to the company's operations. They establish robust internal controls, compliance processes, and contingency plans to ensure business continuity.
Team Management: Chief Cloud Officer is responsible for building and leading a high-performing operational team. They recruit, train, mentor, and evaluate team members, promoting a culture of excellence, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
Stakeholder Management: Chief Cloud Officer interacts with various stakeholders, including board members, investors, clients, suppliers, and regulatory bodies. They represent the company in external forums and build strong relationships to support the organization's strategic objectives.
Overall, Business Unit Leader plays a critical role in overseeing the operational aspects of a company, driving efficiency, and ensuring that all functions work together harmoniously to achieve the organization's goals.

title: Cloud Governance
description:
Description 

On Site 3 days/week in Chicago, Atlanta, Richmond This role will support the Global Cloud Governance environment at a large Financial Institution. These people will execute decision processes for External Cloud Sponsorship Requests, as well as work on Cloud related frameworks and regulations to the policies and standards. This group interfaces with GIS, global records management, risk management, disaster recovery, operational continuity, and sourcing. This group has historically been focused on the initial assessment for use cases, but their focus has recently expanded to validating evidence and making sure evidence supports the assessment. This position will be supporting use case requestors and maintaining official records, as they get a lot of requests for use cases from many different groups that have varying levels of knowledge of cloud – this team will help those groups to understand what they need.

 Skills

title: Cloud Developer - Senior with Security Clearance
description:
Responsibilities

Job Description As a member of our team, you will join a diverse group of driven professionals who design the products and systems that support enhanced capabilities, protect national security, and keep critical information and infrastructure secure. With us, you will be able to make an impact while you hone your skills and grow in your career. BAE Systems is looking for an experienced Cloud Developer to join a strong team supporting our government customer. This position will provide the ability to make a significant impact to the mission. The successful candidate will be responsible for continuously evaluating available services and making recommendations to the government on strategies for implementation. Responsibilities include:

 Strategies for failure/recovery. Cost optimization. Benefit analysis of cloud, cloud agnostic, and on-premises services. 8 years of experience developing comprehensive and innovative technical solutions with at least 1 year experience with 1 of the 3 major cloud service providers (Amazon, Microsoft, or Google). Experience architecting and migrating on-premises applications into a cloud platform. Required Education, Experience, & Skills * Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or other related analytical, scientific, or technical discipline. Associate level certification is a substitute for 2 years' experience. Experience with AWS services, specifically CloudFormation, EC2, Lambda, S3, SQS, SNS Experience with Python and/or JavaScript (specifically NodeJS interactions for Lambda) Experience with Bash & PowerShell scripting Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills * Experience with Docker and AWS ECS and/or EKS Experience with Linux administration Software/COTS: Databricks, Elasticsearch, Accumulo, Hadoop, Docker, Apache NiFi, Apache Kafka, Apache ZooKeeper AWS Suite with Lambda Experience with Infrastructure as Code using Terraform Frameworks: Spring, Hibernate, REST, JSF, Hadoop, HIVE, AWS Services (S3, SQS, SNS, Lambda, Code Commit/Build/Deploy/Pipeline, ECR, ECS) Pay Information

Full-Time Salary Range: $115100 - $195700 Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience. Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics. About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it's what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts - defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team-making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you'll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference. Intelligence & Security (I&S), based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do-from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels. Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:

At BAE Systems, we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where employees are valued and feel like they belong. We are conscious of the need for all employees to see themselves reflected at every level of the company and know that in order to unlock the full potential of our workforce, everyone must feel confident being their best, most sincere self and be equipped to thrive. We provide impactful professional development experiences to our employees and invest in social impact partnerships to uplift communities and drive purposeful change. Here you will find significant opportunities to do meaningful work in an environment intentionally designed to be one where you will learn, grow and belong.

title: Public Cloud Solution Engineering Lead
description:
Who we are looking for:

A Public Cloud Solution Engineering Lead, AVP to drive programs that involve cross-organizational and strategic initiatives. This is large scale, multi-year complex program which will support Public Cloud migration strategy focused on Technology Modernization.

You will be working with Application Development teams, Cloud Architects, platform engineering, infrastructure, and operations teams to help implement Application Modernization strategies. You will lead Application Modernization Solution Engineering teams span across global development locations, by understanding current state challenges, help establish a well-considered roadmap, help identify creative solutions for technical challenges and provide expert planning leading to execute the program on time and on budget with least business disruption.

It is essential you have strong application development lifecycle experience, understanding of Modern Technology stack, database and application performance diagnosis, distributed computing and strong end-to-end program and project management experience working with a large portfolios of projects that support a complex organizational environment.

Responsibilities include:

Guiding multi-year Application Modernize programs in a large federated organizations, with multiple stakeholders and conflicting requirementsLead large Development teams supporting Public Cloud technology roadmap implementation Work with Development teams on implementing modern technology stack, identify pain points and opportunities for improvements, encourage collaboration and leverage knowledge sharing across development communitiesDevelop partnership with Architects, Engineering and Operational teams to improve technology experience around Public Cloud for Development communityAbility to manage modernization effort for large portfolio by developing implementation cloud roadmap, oversee execution plan, own and resolve impediments to meet organization OKRs.Prior experience migrating application workloads on a cloud provider (AWS, Azure) in financial services would be a plus.1-2 Certifications on the appropriate cloud provider (e.g., AWS practitioner) .Manage large projects and priorities within a rapidly changing Organization focused on Transformation at Scale.Manage conflicts with multiple stakeholders while keeping the project goals in focus.Ability to help create lightweight processes where needed to streamline project delivery.Prior working knowledge of JIRA and Confluence.


What We Value

Exhibits a strategic mindset with strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skillsDemonstrates accountability and a bias for action to successfully execute upon goals to deliver high quality work, on time and on budget


Education & Preferred Qualifications

B.S. in Computer Science or a related technical discipline5-10 years of experience in hands-on Application Development and technical product/program managementExcellent knowledge on Public Cloud tech stack, experience in designing, deploying, and supporting enterprise workloads to the cloud5+ years of Project Management experience leading Technology or transformation initiatives, managing multiple, cross-functional global development teams or projects, and influencing senior-level management and key stakeholders.Strong experience in Cloud Native technologies like Microservices, Containerization and Container OrchestrationExperience working directly with global Development teamsAbility to coordinate multiple initiatives through various phases of SDLCExperience effectively bringing teams together across global regionsExtremely detail and solution orientedExcellent oral and written communication skillsAbility to diplomatically and effectively manage issues across functional teamsSuccessful candidate should be enthusiastic, keen to be part of a growing team

Experience with Agile (Scrum, Kanban) and DevSecOps methodologies.

WHAT GDIT CAN OFFER YOU

Full-flex work week401K with company matchCustomizable health benefits packagesCollaborative teams of highly motivated critical thinkers and innovatorsInternal mobility team dedicated to helping you own your careerRewards program for high-performing employees

GDIT CAREERS

Our benefits package for all US-based employees includes a variety of medical plan options, some with Health Savings Accounts, dental plan options, a vision plan, and a 401(k) plan offering the ability to contribute both pre and post-tax dollars up to the IRS annual limits and receive a company match. To encourage work/life balance, GDIT offers employees full flex work weeks where possible and a variety of paid time off plans, including vacation, sick and personal time, holidays, paid parental, military, bereavement and jury duty leave. GDIT typically provides new employees with 15 days of paid leave per calendar year to be used for vacations, personal business, and illness and an additional 10 paid holidays per year. Paid leave and paid holidays are prorated based on the employee’s date of hire. The GDIT Paid Family Leave program provides a total of up to 160 hours of paid leave in a rolling 12 month period for eligible employees. To ensure our employees are able to protect their income, other offerings such as short and long-term disability benefits, life, accidental death and dismemberment, personal accident, critical illness and business travel and accident insurance are provided or available. We are GDIT. Our 30,000 experts extract the power of technology to create immediate value and deliver solutions at the edge of innovation. We operate across 30 countries worldwide, offering leading capabilities in digital modernization, AI/ML, Cloud, Cyber and application development. Together with our clients, we strive to create a safer, smarter world by harnessing the power of deep expertise and advanced technology.

We connect people with the most impactful client missions, creating an unparalleled work experience that allows them to see their impact every day. We create opportunities for our people to lead and learn simultaneously. From securing our nation’s most sensitive systems, to enabling digital transformation and cloud adoption, our people are the ones who make change real.

title: Senior Cloud Network Analyst - Corporate IT (Kansas City)
description:
Description

As a Cloud Network Analyst, you will play a crucial role in maintaining the stability, security, and efficiency of our LAN, WAN and cross-cloud and internal cloud network infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with multi-cloud networking, a strong understanding of network protocols, cloud network peering, cloud security services, Palo Alto firewalls and a proven track record in troubleshooting and optimizing network performance. What you will do

Design, deploy, and manage cloud-based network infrastructure using platforms such as Azure, AWS, and Google Cloud.Configure and maintain virtual networks, subnets, and security groups to ensure optimal performance and security.Deploy VPC and VNET cloud network boundaries and associated policiesDeploy and maintain cloud network peering and routing services like Azure vWAN and AWS Transit Gateways.Configure and deploy cloud network load balancing and security services like cloud firewalls and WAFs.Design, configure and manage cloud DNS solutions like AWS Route 53Deploy cloud network configurations utilizing Infrastructure as Code – specifically Terraform.Develop and implement cloud network architecture, ensuring seamless connectivity between on-premises infrastructure and cloud services including private connectivity solutions like ExpressRoute, Direct Connect and cloud network exchanges like Equinix and MegaportCollaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement scalable and resilient network solutions.Monitor and analyze cloud network performance, identifying and resolving issues to ensure high availability and reliability.Implement strategies for load balancing, auto-scaling, and disaster recovery to optimize resource utilization.Provide technical support for cloud-related network issues, working closely with other IT teams to resolve incidents promptly.Document and maintain network configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting guides.Collaborate with system administrators, developers, and other IT staff to ensure seamless integration of cloud services.Communicate effectively with stakeholders to gather requirements, provide updates, and address concerns.Respond to network incidents and outages promptly, conducting root cause analysis and implementing corrective actions.Assist the Network Operations team in the installation, configuration, maintenance and troubleshooting of the LAN, WAN, and wireless network environments.Identify and analyze new technologies and alternative systems to enhance security, reliability and customer experience.

Qualifications

Required

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field.Relevant certifications (e.g., Azure Fundamentals, Azure Network Engineer, AWS Cloud Practitioner, etc) are a plus.Significant experience building and managing networks in Microsoft Azure.Strong understanding of cloud computing concepts, virtualization, and networking protocols.Experience deploying cloud network configurations using Terraform.Experience with network security practices, including firewalls, VPNs, and encryption.Experience with multi-cloud connectivity.Strong ability to influence or lead enterprise integration project execution.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Ability to be on-call after-hours on a rotating basis.

Preferred

Experience with cloud-based network infrastructure in all four major cloud platforms - Azure, AWS, GCP, and OCI.Experience managing LAN, WAN, and wireless networks.Experience with SD-WAN technology.Familiarity with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) is desirable.Certification in relevant networking technologies (e.g., CCNA, CWNA)In-depth knowledge of networking protocols and technologies (TCP/IP, VLANs, OSPF, BGP, etc.)Experience with Cisco and Meraki network hardware.Experience with network automation tools.

Job Networking

Other Locations United States

Travel: No

title: Technical Program Manager L6 - Cloud Games
description:
Netflix

At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and, over the last few years, have been expanding our offerings to products like Live and Games. We aspire to connect our members with a variety of high-quality games that they’ll enjoy, starting with mobile but expanding to additional devices through the cloud. We make games for all members, with the conviction that everyone can have fun in a game if we put the right experience in front of them. We want Netflix to be a global top-5 game company, known as much for its great games as its awesome shows and movies.

The Role

This role will work closely with the Infrastructure Engineering, Game Experience Engineering, Product, and Games Studios to ensure we are delivering efficient, scalable, and reliable game streaming infrastructure that is a core part of our Cloud Games program. We are looking for an experienced technical program manager who can partner closely with engineering managers, engineers, product managers, and other technical program managers to execute complex technical programs. If you’re looking for a technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of software engineering at Netflix, we’d love to talk to you!


What You Will Do


Build and manage the roadmap, in collaboration with technical teams (including Engineering, Product, Data Science, Game Studio, etc), that focus on building a highly efficient, scalable, reliable, and secure infrastructureLeverage deep knowledge and functional expertise to drive road mapping, execution planning and cross-functional alignment across multiple stakeholder groups.Craft and drive engagement with partners, work to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with multiple engineering teams, track progress towards goals, and report status to product, customers, and technical leadership.Champion breaking out annual goals into measurable milestones while proactively managing risks, blockers, and delays.Manage cross-functional dependencies, risks, and changes effectively by optimizing scope, schedule, and resources accordingly.



What We Are Looking For


You have domain expertise in one of the following areas: server infrastructure, distributed systems, game performance optimizationYou are highly skilled, experienced, and enjoy orchestrating programs with many moving parts - people, needs, and technologiesYou have an ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches and weigh-in on product vs technology tradeoffsYou aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty, pulling data to provide insight, debug issues, and monitor system healthYou have a data driven mindset in your decision makingYou have a deep understanding and point of view within your technical domain(s) of expertise



Basic Qualifications


10+ years of experience driving large scale SW projects with engineering and product teams4+ years of software engineering, systems engineering or technical product/program management experienceExperience managing projects across cross functional teams, building sustainable processes and coordinating release schedulesExcellent written and verbal communication skills, including clear articulation of business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audienceSelf-starter who enjoys tackling 0 to 1 problem spaces and quickly bringing organization and direction



Additive Qualifications


Experience in cloud gaming and/or distributed systems


Location of work: 

Our organization has a distributed team across the US. We are considering candidates who are willing to relocate to Los Gatos, California. The expectation is that candidates will work during core Pacific Standard Time business hours.

Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $240,000 - $725,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more details about our Benefits here.

Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

Talentify is not the EOR (Employer of Record) for this position. Our role in this specific opportunity is to connect outstanding candidates with a top-tier employer.

Talentify helps candidates around the world to discover and stay focused on the jobs they want until they can complete a full application in the hiring company career page/ATS.

title: Senior Cloud Pre-Sales Solution Engineer - Oracle GDI with Security Clearance
description:
Job Description Due to rapid growth, Oracle GDI - Government, Defense & Intelligence, is adding two Senior Pre-Sales Cloud Solutions Engineers! In this role, you will be supporting the Intelligence Community to be the expert for formulating and leading presales technical / functional support activity to prospective clients and customers while ensuring customer satisfaction. This role seeks a candidate looking for a dynamic technical environment with unlimited growth. Those who excel in this role are motivated self-starters who love to solve challenging problems, feel comfortable working directly with customers, and have an insatiable curiosity about what "is possible" with cloud technology. This is a Hybrid role with the ideal candidate based in the Annapolis Junction MD area. Responsibilities What you will do (Responsibilities): As a Pre-Sales Cloud Solutions Engineer, you must have solid experience and a passion for cloud concepts, system integration, and cloud migrations that can support customer facing engagements along with internal Oracle sales efforts. * Must have experience supporting the Intelligence Community

 Responsible for providing leadership and expertise in the development and strategic direction of new solutions, products, and processes. Works directly with customers to gather requirements, develop architectures and translates complex business needs into solutions; May implement solutions and ensure successful deployments. Serves as an acknowledged authority for customers and sales on technical cloud solutions and customer success. Identifies gaps and enhancements to influence engineering roadmaps for customer driven features. * Maintains expertise by staying current on emerging technologies; * Project management; Solving technical problems with customers in technical environments; * Written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills; * Needs analysis, positioning, and business justification. * 10 +years experience and expertise in the clear communication of technical information to others through presentations, demonstrations, written communication and consultative solutioning experience Travel up to 25% may be needed. * Required: Must possess or have the ability to obtain and maintain TS/SCI eligibility with Poly.Additional Desired Skillsets: * Knowledge and experience with any of public cloud providers including Oracle, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Azure or Google (GCP) architecture, tools, and cloud methodologies. Solution Architect and/or Developer Certification on Oracle Cloud, AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Experience with government accreditations for Cloud such as FedRAMP, Impact Level, and ICD 503Preferred, but not required: * Advanced degree in relevant field of studies highly desirable.Come Join Us!

title: Senior Cloud Security Engineer
description:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Motion Recruitment Partners, LLC, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

Senior Cloud Security Engineer

Company Overview: A cloud-native health-tech startup based in Tampa Bay is hiring for a senior cloud security engineer. This is an opportunity to join a growing team in the healthcare space that has invested a lot into their security efforts. You would be on a robust team of engineers and architects and have a lot of growth potential.

Position: Senior Azure Cloud Security Engineer

Location: Tampa, FL (Open to Remote)

Responsibilities:

Lead the design, implementation, and management of security measures for our Azure cloud infrastructure, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate security best practices into the entire development lifecycle, from design to deployment. Conduct risk assessments and vulnerability management, implementing strategies to mitigate and remediate identified security risks. Develop and enforce security policies, procedures, and standards related to Azure cloud services and health data protection. Monitor and respond to security incidents, conduct investigations, and implement incident response procedures as needed. Design and implement identity and access management (IAM) solutions for secure access control. Stay abreast of the latest Azure cloud security trends, threats, and vulnerabilities, and implement proactive measures to address emerging risks. Provide mentorship and guidance to junior members of the security team. 

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. Advanced certifications such as CISSP, Azure Security Engineer, or related certifications are highly desirable. Proven experience in designing, implementing, and managing security in Azure cloud environments, with a focus on health technology or healthcare industry experience. In-depth knowledge of Azure security services, including Azure Active Directory, Azure Key Vault, Azure Security Center, and Azure Sentinel. Strong understanding of health data security and compliance requirements, such as HIPAA and HITRUST. Experience with security automation and scripting using tools like PowerShell or Azure CLI. Familiarity with DevSecOps principles and integrating security into CI/CD pipelines. Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to convey complex security concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders. Demonstrated leadership experience in guiding and mentoring security teams. 

Benefits:

Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses. Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance. Retirement savings plans and company matching. Flexible work arrangements, including remote options. Opportunities for professional development and continuous learning.

title: Cloud Security Engineer III
description:
Overview

IDEMIA is the global leader in identity and security. Our mission is to create a safe and simple future where identity verification is indisputable, and only you can assert your identity. We are a distributed company leveraging the latest technologies to deliver world-class products in the private and public sectors of finance, telecom, identity, security, retail, sports entertainment, commercial, government, and IoT. We use a variety of technologies and approaches to deliver quality product and services to government agencies and technology companies. IDEMIA is a made up of a group of 14,000 diverse people from different nationalities, speaking over 20 different languages. Together, our solutions impact the everyday lives of citizens and nations. In this ever-changing world, protecting your identity is paramount. Join the team that is ensuring one person - one identity.

Responsibilities

IDEMIA is looking for a proactive Cloud Security Engineer III with AWS/Azure cloud infrastructure monitoring experience to join our security team. The individual will help protect our customer data and reduce our organization’s cyber risk by using and optimizing security tools such as Splunk, Tenable, Okta, CrowdStrike, as well as providing security incident response cycle support. The candidate should be able to demonstrate technical capabilities and in-depth knowledge of cloud infrastructure and security concepts, technologies, and best practices. This position will require a hands-on knowledge of AWS/Azure cloud and infrastructure, log investigation techniques, vulnerability assessments, risk assessment, and incident handling experience.

 Implement and optimize security controls and mechanisms of AWS cloud infrastructure including initial and ongoing configuration of related automation and administration.  Act as the subject matter expert for cloud security and associated tools such as Splunk, Tenable, Okta, and CrowdStrike.  Monitor Cloud infrastructure and proactively mitigate potential incidents before service degradation occurs.  Provide guidance to our DevOps teams developing on public Cloud platforms, advising on security standards for Cloud deployment, and working to identify common patterns for template provisioning.  Conduct assessments of security controls for new and existing cloud systems.  Create and maintain as-built system documentation, architecture diagrams, and online collaborative documentation such as Wiki.  Determine security modes of operation and recommending new or revised security measures and countermeasures for current security challenges.  Assumes responsibility for other duties as required or assigned. 

Qualifications

 Must be a US citizen without dual citizenship  4+ years of demonstrable experience with AWS Cloud Security infrastructure and tools  Experience with three or more of the following AWS services: GuardDuty, CloudTrail, CloudWatch, Inspector, SecurityHub, TrustedAdvisor, Config, ControlTower / GuardRails  Experience using organizational cloud governance constructs (e.g., AWS Organizations including OUs and SCPs)  A strong understanding and experience with IAM including roles and policies  A strong understanding and experience with cloud access control & security mechanisms (e.g., ACL, Security Groups, VPCs)  Bachelor's degree in computer science, cybersecurity, or other related discipline  AWS Certified Security - Specialty, ISC2, or Cloud Security Alliance certifications are desired  Experience in at least one scripting environment applicable to the AWS CLI  Knowledge of one or more Infrastructure as Code toolsets  Experience in supporting NIST 800-53 and SOC 2 is a plus  Disciplined self-starter who can successfully bring projects and tasks to closure with a minimum of direction, guidance, and oversight  Team player with the ability to interact and communicate with clients and peers in a positive, collaborative, and constructive manner  Good organizational and time management skills to handle multiple tasks simultaneously  Strong documentation and communication skills

title: Cloud Computing systems Engineer
description:
Job Description

This job is responsible for technical and operational support of cloud infrastructure resources in Microsoft Azure and Oracle cloud. This role provides support to ensure the highest levels of systems and cloud infrastructure availability. The Cloud Systems Engineer will work closely with Cloud Engineering Leads to deliver standard, automated deployments via code and pipelines. This role will work with Software Engineering, Data Services, Data Scientists, and Solutions Architects to develop and document requirements for application and PaaS service configuration, testing, validation, and deployments. The Cloud Systems Engineer is responsible for platforms and installed systems in order to meet business needs, deadlines, and objectives for regulatory compliance.

Responsibilities

Assists in strategizing Azure/ Oracle Cloud Engineering executionDevelops and implements standards and best practices as it relates to cloud solutionsLeads efforts to provision infrastructure using infrastructure as code tooling. Leverages automation to monitor and orchestrate client environmentsImplements Cloud standards, DevOps / CICD tool chain and Standard Operating Environment (SOE). Supports business requirements by conducting business needs assessments and analysisKeeps up with patches and updates to enable new functionality and address vulnerabilities. Conducts research on emerging technologies in support of cloud and infrastructure development efforts and recommends technologies that will increase cost effectiveness and infrastructure flexibility. Works with Kubernetes, Docker, and other container technologiesDeploys of all Azure PaaS services (API, AKS, AppService, FrontDoor etc.)

Qualifications

2+ w/Bachelor's degree2 years as an Azure cloud engineer focusing on IaC and PaaS Services (AKS, AppService etc.)Strong written and verbal communication skillsStrong communications / interpersonal skillsExcellent troubleshooting skills. Solid understanding of Azure public cloud platform. Knowledge of software development life cycle. Knowledge of programming languages and web based technologies. Strong analytical and critical thinking skillsBroad knowledge of cloud computing concepts and solutions. Knowledge of infrastructure management within a cloud environment. Knowledge of cloud delivery models. Knowledge of web services, API Gateway, Elastic/Network Load BalancersProficiency in modern software architecture using CI/CD, DevOps, Scalability, API first strategy and etc. required. 

Base Pay Information

The national base pay range at the end is a good-faith estimate of what Delta Dental may pay for new hires. Actual pay may vary based on Delta Dental's assessment of the candidate's knowledge, skills, abilities (KSAs), related experience, education, certifications and ability to meet required minimum job qualifications. Other factors impacting pay include prevailing wages in the work location and internal equity. $69,999.72 - $146,600

Additional Information

Rewards to make you smile! We don't just want to make our customers happy - we want to give our employees a reason to smile, too. Delta Dental's comprehensive benefits package includes:

 Generous paid time off plus 12 holidays and your birthday off!Low-cost premium medical insurance options100% paid dental and vision insuranceGenerous 401(k) matching and flat contributionSocial responsibility and volunteer opportunities, including 16 paid volunteer hours annuallyEmployee LiveWell program, focusing on overall employee well-beingFertility and diabetes benefitsEmployee discount program: AT&T/Verizon, entertainment, travel, and more!Culture of learning: career development and tuition reimbursementCareer growth: we love promoting from within

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

About The Team

At Delta Dental, our success is only as strong as the people who execute it! We take enormous pride in being the nation's most recognized and widely-used provider of dental insurance - and we've come this far by living our core values of innovation, excellence, service and trust. Our vision is to motivate and empower every employee so that we're all inspired to take exceptional care of our customers, providers and ourselves. We believe in integrity, accountability, collaboration, and giving every employee equitable opportunity for their voice to be heard and development to be fostered.

If you're excited about the prospect of transforming the future of health care and growing in your career, join our smile revolution!

To see some of the smiling faces behind Delta Dental and to learn more about what our values and culture look like in action, connect with us on social media: Delta Dental Ins. on Facebook and Instagram, on Facebook and Instagram, Delta Dental Ins. on Twitter and Delta Dental Ins. on LinkedIn.

We are part of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of companies that provides dental coverage to 74 million people in the U.S. Delta Dental of California, Delta Dental of New York, Inc., Delta Dental of Pennsylvania and Delta Dental Insurance Company, together with our affiliate companies, form one of the nation's largest dental benefits delivery systems, covering 33 million enrollees. All of our companies are members, or affiliates of members, of the Delta Dental Plans Association, a network of 39 Delta Dental companies throughout the country.

Delta Dental is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building and maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace for all employees. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender or identity expression, age, disability, marital status, medical status, veteran status or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. In addition to federal law requirements, Delta Dental complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Unfortunately, our Delta Dental Enterprise is unable to hire individuals residing in Alaska, North Dakota, Nebraska, Hawaii, Oklahoma, Vermont, Maine, West Virginia, New Hampshire, Wyoming, Puerto Rico or other US Territories at this time.

Proof of eligibility to work in the United States must be provided if selected for hire.

Delta Dental includes: Delta Dental of California, Delta Dental Insurance Company, Delta Dental of Pennsylvania, and Delta Dental of New York

If You Are A Current Employee Click Here To Apply

title: Staff Software Engineer - Cloud Platform
description:
Job Description

Work Arrangement:

Hybrid: This role is categorized as hybrid. This means the successful candidate is expected to report to Austin, Sunnyvale, or Warren three times per week, at minimum.

The Role:

The Digital Product Engineering team is a dynamic and fast paced organization that designs, develops, and maintains all applications and solutions that create the entire interactive experience for customers and vehicles at General Motors. We are developing a world-class GM experience for our customers and driving real change in the most iconic automaker on the planet. Our team delivers unique software solutions in cutting-edge technologies such as mobility, telematics, mission-critical business systems, supercomputing, cloud, vehicle engineering and real-time computing. We offer challenging positions for passionate professionals looking to advance their careers and be a part of an organization focused on innovation, speed, and business value.

The Cloud Platform Engineering and Services Team is seeking an experienced Staff Software Engineer to lead and work with engineering teams across the Digital Product Engineering space to build and manage a cloud-based shared platform. The Digital Product Engineering systems include many customer-facing and back-office services required to deliver subscription-based and eCommerce services with this role focused on building a platform for supporting these experiences in a multi-cloud ecosystem. Additionally, this team works closely with the Engineering, Architecture and SRE teams to develop and standardize new patterns, libraries and services that are needed as part of GM’s digital product transformation.

 

Responsibilities:

The ideal candidate has past experiences successfully leading and solving complex software engineering problems across multiple teams. These experiences should include both significant breadth and depth of supporting multiple technical workstreams. This role will lead and define the strategy for distributed compute and data repositories (RDBMS, Document Storage, No-SQL, Streaming Brokers, etc.) used in GM’s Digital Products platform for both transactional and analytics providers.

Additional Job Description

Your Skills & Abilities (Required Qualifications):

8+ years of software engineering and design experience in building and operating a public cloud platform supporting a global customer software and services offeringKnowledge of operating system, networking and systems engineering managementExperience with Container Orchestration (Kubernetes preferred) and Infrastructure as Code tools (Terraform preferred)Advanced programming language proficiency in Java, Python or GoExpertise in end-to-end applications hosted on Kubernetes with a focus on scalability, high availability, and fault tolerance including the engineering of Operators and CRDsExperience in designing and engineering highly-available public cloud services (Azure, GCP and AWS)Experience with open-source, cloud-native products supporting complex applications and services (ex- Service Mesh, Service Discovery, Routing, Logging Infrastructure, CI/CD tools, etc.)Experience with cross-functional leadership across product engineering, architecture, security and cloud vendor organizationsExcellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to effectively communicate and translate feedback, needs and solutions Creative problem-solving skills that deliver elegant solutions to complex issues Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering or related field, or equivalent combination of education and recent, relevant work experience


About GM

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.

Benefits Overview

The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others:

 Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents; Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family; Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement; Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values; Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing; Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends.


Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities. GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statements

GM is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. GM is committed to providing a work environment free from unlawful discrimination and advancing equal employment opportunities for all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, all practices and decisions relating to terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, discipline, compensation, benefits, and termination of employment are made without regard to an individual's protected characteristics. For purposes of this policy, “protected characteristics" include an individual's actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), gender identity or gender expression, sexual orientation, weight, height, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, email us at Careers.Accommodations@GM.com or call us at 800-865-7580. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.

Benefits Overview

The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others:

 Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents; Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family; Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement; Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values; Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing; Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends.


Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities. GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statements

GM is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. GM is committed to providing a work environment free from unlawful discrimination and advancing equal employment opportunities for all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, all practices and decisions relating to terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, discipline, compensation, benefits, and termination of employment are made without regard to an individual's protected characteristics. For purposes of this policy, “protected characteristics" include an individual's actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), gender identity or gender expression, sexual orientation, weight, height, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, email us at Careers.Accommodations@GM.com or call us at 800-865-7580. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.

title: Cloud Automation Manager
description:
Job ID 2405140

Location RICHMOND, VA, US

Date Posted 2024-04-08

Category Information Technology

Subcategory Cloud Comp Engr

Schedule Full-time

Shift Day Job

Travel Yes, 10 % of the Time

Minimum Clearance Required None

Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain None

Potential for Remote Work No

Description

SAIC is currently looking for a Cloud Automation Manager. The Cloud Automation Manager is responsible for overseeing the design, development, implementation, and maintenance of the organization's cloud automation infrastructure, ensuring scalability, security, automated deployment and ordering of cloud-based services. This role involves expertise in cloud environment design, engineering, quality assurance, troubleshooting, database management, security, compliance, backup, disaster recovery, performance optimization, automation, issue resolution, collaboration, and documentation.

This is a Hybrid remote role. It will require working on site 2 days a week in Richmond, VA.

Responsibilities And Duties

 Cloud Workflow Design and Development Design, develop, and ensure the quality assurance and testing of cloud automation workflows to meet organizational needs utilizing Morpheus Cloud Management Platform. Cloud Standards and Practices Apply experienced knowledge of standards, practices, and automation for cloud infrastructure. Troubleshooting and Problem Resolution Troubleshoot and resolve issues impacting operational systems and services, ensuring minimal downtime. Database Management Manage the organization's databases, including design, installation, configuration, backup, recovery, and performance tuning. Cloud Service Selection Evaluate cloud services and select the most appropriate services for development based on customer demand and automation capabilities. Security and Compliance Implement and maintain robust security measures for both cloud and database environments, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations. Backup and Disaster Recovery Ensuring information security by recommending and implementing benchmarks best practices regarding backup and recovery of the cloud automation environment. Performance Optimization Monitor and analyze system performance, identify bottlenecks, and implement optimizations to improve efficiency. Automation Implement automation and orchestration tools to streamline cloud provisioning, database management tasks, and routine maintenance. Collaboration Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, program leadership, customer leadership, and security professionals, to ensure seamless integration and operation of cloud-based services and databases. Documentation Maintain accurate documentation of cloud configurations, database schemas, policies, and procedures to facilitate knowledge sharing and troubleshooting.

Qualifications

Required Education and Experience 

 Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field and nine (9) or more years of total experience ; Masters and seven (7) or PhD and four (4). May accept an additional 4 years of experience in lieu of a degree. Minimum of 5 years of demonstrated expertise in cloud infrastructure management. Proven experience with cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), and database management systems like MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, MongoDB. Strong understanding and experience of networking, security, and data management best practices. Experience with automation and scripting languages such as AWS CLI, PowerShell, Python. Experience with Morpheus Cloud Management Platform is a large plus. Industry certifications such as AWS Certified SysOps Administrator, Microsoft Certified Azure Database Administrator, or equivalent Must be able to pass a background check

SAIC accepts applications on an ongoing basis and there is no deadline.

Covid Policy SAIC does not require COVID-19 vaccinations or boosters. Customer site vaccination requirements must be followed when work is performed at a customer site.

title: Staff Software Engineer - Cloud Platform
description:

Work Arrangement:

This role is categorized as hybrid. This means the successful candidate is expected to report to the Milford Proving Grounds in Milford, MI three times per week, at minimum.

The Role: 

The Cloud Platform Engineering and Services Team is seeking an experienced Staff Software Engineer to lead and work with engineering teams across the Digital Product Engineering space to build and manage a cloud-based shared platform. The Digital Product Engineering systems include many customer-facing and back-office services required to deliver subscription-based and eCommerce services with this role focused on building a platform for supporting these experiences in a multi-cloud ecosystem.

title: Principal Cloud Security Engineer
description:
Join a leading organization dedicated to innovation and excellence, operating in the dynamic fields of manufacturing and government services.
As a Principal Cloud Security Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in advancing our cybersecurity objectives by providing expert guidance and implementing robust security controls for our cloud environments. 
Key Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Cybersecurity, Information Systems, or equivalent.Eight or more years of cybersecurity experience, with a focus on cloud security.Industry certifications such as CISSP, CEH, GIAC, Security+, SSAP, etc.Direct experience with Azure Cloud Security (AWS experience is desirable).Experience working in manufacturing or government environments.
Responsibilities:Design, implement, and maintain monitoring and alerting solutions for detecting unauthorized access and potential threats in cloud environments.Collaborate with architects and analysts to ensure security solutions align with business objectives and regulatory requirements.Serve as a trusted advisor to business functional areas and internal IT resources, ensuring alignment with cybersecurity policies.Advocate for cyber risk mitigation during planning and implementation of new technology services.Maintain awareness of information security and compliance standards, contributing to the development of cybersecurity strategies and roadmaps.Contribute to the development and continuous improvement of cybersecurity programs, including threat management, data governance, and cloud security.Work with CSIRT to improve processes, procedures, and training related to cybersecurity incident response.
Skills:Proficiency in scripting languages such as Powershell, Terraform, Java, JavaScript, and Python.Demonstrated conceptual, analytical, and problem-solving skills.Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to convey technical information to diverse audiences.Experience with complex projects and issues across multiple technical areas and lines of business.Knowledge of security controls for networks, applications, and operating systems.Familiarity with InfoSec systems such as SEIM, SOAR, IDS/IPS, and Sandbox Analysis Tools.Ability to obtain or hold an active U.S. Government Secret level clearance.Direct experience with SEIM or SOAR platforms is advantageous.
If you are passionate about cybersecurity and thrive in a collaborative environment where your expertise can make a difference, we invite you to apply for the role of Principal Cloud Security Engineer. 
Nesco Resource provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Sr. Cloud & Network Engineer - Contract
description:
For more than two decades, Telestream has been at the forefront of innovation in the digital video industry, pioneering file-based video transcoding and high-quality media exchange over IP networks. Telestream provides world-class live and on-demand digital video tools and workflow solutions that allow businesses and consumers to transform video on the desktop and across the enterprise. Many of the world's most demanding media and entertainment companies such as CBS, BBC, CNN, FOX, CBC, Comcast, Direct TV, Time Warner, MTV, Discovery and Lifetime, as well as a growing number of users in a broad range of business environments, rely on Telestream products to streamline operations, reach broader audiences, and generate more revenue from their media. If you're looking for an industry leader in the high growth area of video, Telestream is for you.Sr. Network and Cloud Engineer – Remote, USA (Contract)Position Summary:
The Senior Network & Cloud Engineer is an enthusiastic technical professional supporting all levels of IT network and cloud/SaaS operations. The ideal candidate will have experience in designing, implementing, and maintaining functional network infrastructure both on-prem and in the cloud. They will be responsible for resolving issues that tiers of support have escalated, mentoring team members, and addressing user needs while supporting all security evolution and compliance auditing as needed.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Develop programs/procedures to enhance the Cloud/LAN/WAN & SaaS operation, security, and performance.Provides technical expertise in network topology development, implementation, and assessment of network technologies.Keep abreast of technological changes for Cloud/LAN/WAN products and recommend those products.Perform or assist in formal assessments or audits of the Cloud and network infrastructure.Perform Cloud/LAN/WAN-related assignments, such as budget assistance, preventive maintenance issues, and support for hardware and operating systems acquired in the future, as requested by the Vice President of IT.Attend classes and trade shows related to the Cloud industry.Configure, implement, maintain, distribute, and document network hardware and software.Monitor, manage, and document Cloud connectivity performance.Develop and maintain disaster recovery procedures.Provide second-level end-user support as needed.Act as an internal consultant to other IT functions and business groups as appropriate.Work with the vendor and users in the planning, implementation, change control, testing, documentation, performance monitoring, capacity planning, problem resolution, and disaster recovery setup for Cloud, internet, or network-specific related platforms.Work with the vendor, users, and security specialists in the security administration for Cloud, internet, or network-specific related platforms.Work with Security Specialists and Engineering teams to ensure the hardening of any systems and devices and that patches are applied as necessary.Liaise with project stakeholders on an ongoing basis.Monitor system resource utilization, trending, and capacity planning.Configure and install various network devices and services (e.g., routers, switches, firewalls, load balancers, VPN, QoS)Perform network maintenance and system upgrades, including service packs, patches, hotfixes, and security configurations. Qualifications:A minimum of 3-5 years of experience in the installation and support of information LAN/WAN network infrastructure and support of on-prem & cloud storage solutions.Be a go-getter implementing and supporting networked environments with a passion for learning new technology and documenting your knowledge for your peers.Manufacture certifications are a plus.Solid understanding of the OSI/TCP/IP ModelsExperience building and supporting IPV6Selecting, implementing, and supporting third-party vendor solutionsA minimum of 7-10 years of experience in the installation and support of Cloud-based servicesExperience leading in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.Experience managing highly available disaster-resistant global wide area networks.Strong experience with formal Disaster Recovery planning and processes.Experience in colocation environments and hybrid cloud network configurations.Hands-on experience with network performance monitoring, network diagnostic, and network analytics solutions.Deep understanding of networking protocols (e.g., IPSEC, HSRP, BGP, OSPF, 802.11, QoS)Experience supporting core business application day-to-day operations, process transformation activity 
Physical/Mental Requirements:
An employee must meet the physical demands described here to perform the essential functions of this job successfully. 
Have the mental capacity to analyze data and perform basic statistical analyses (computer-assisted).
