title: Cloud Systems Engineer II
description:
How will this role have an impact?

We are looking to hire an experienced Cloud & Infrastructure engineer to manage and maintain our company’s enterprise systems and services. As a Cloud & Infrastructure engineer, you will be responsible for handling advanced support issues, maintaining branch office and Cloud based services.. Ultimately, you will be responsible for the functional management of our environment, the delegation of tasks, and the resolution of incidents.

To ensure success as a Cloud & Infrastructure engineer, you should have extensive experience working with enterprise Cloud & Infrastructure environments, high-level managerial skills, and advanced project management skills. The Cloud & Infrastructure engineer ensures the team performs as a cohesive unit, maintaining the stability and performance of the Cloud and Infrastructure environments.

Not only can you help us connect the dots and evolve our cloud capabilities over time, but you’re also evolving your own capabilities as an engineer and keeping an eye on developments that can support our expansion and help us implement those, too!

This role will report to our Director of Network, Voice and Infrastructure Operations

What will you do?

Operate, design and implement functional company Cloud and Infrastructure environmentsInstalling and configuring Cloud and Infrastructure servicesCreating and implementing security measures with Security Operations teamsManaging and mentoring other engineersConducting regular Cloud and Infrastructure performance testsPerforming maintenance tasks to ensure availabilityDealing with escalated support issuesReporting up Cloud and Infrastructure status reports (monthly)Orchestrating and automating cloud-based platforms throughout the companyWrite and implement protocols company-wide via department policies and proceduresStay current with industry trends, making recommendations as needed to help the company excel

We Are Looking For Someone With

Previous work experience as a Cloud and Infrastructure engineer (4+ years)Advanced knowledge of infrastructure, network and cloud protocolsAdvanced knowledge of Infrastructure systems including Windows Server, Active Directory, LDAP, VDI, Backup and Restore (BaaS)Advanced knowledge of Cloud environments including Azure and AWSFamiliarity with SSL certificates and related applicationsExtensive experience with open-source technology, software development and system engineeringInterest in Cloud and Infrastructure Engineering and its impact on business practicesExcellent leadership and mentoring skillsExcellent communication and organizational skills, and the ability to stay focused on completing tasks and meeting goals within a busy workspace Skilled at working with a team of engineers, or alone as requiredCertification as an Azure / Windows Administrator/Architect Certification, AWS Solutions Architect and/or Cloud Security Certification

The base salary hiring range for this position is $72,100 to $125,600. Compensation offered will be determined by factors such as location, level, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Certain roles may be eligible for incentive compensation, equity, and benefits.

In addition to your compensation, enjoy the rewards of an organization that puts our heart into caring for our colleagues and our communities. Eligible employees may enroll in a full range of medical, dental, and vision benefits, 401(k) retirement savings plan, and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan. We also offer education assistance, free development courses, paid time off programs, paid holidays, a CVS store discount, and discount programs with participating partners.

About Us

Signify Health is helping build the healthcare system we all want to experience by transforming the home into the healthcare hub. We coordinate care holistically across individuals’ clinical, social, and behavioral needs so they can enjoy more healthy days at home. By building strong connections to primary care providers and community resources, we’re able to close critical care and social gaps, as well as manage risk for individuals who need help the most. This leads to better outcomes and a better experience for everyone involved.

Our high-performance networks are powered by more than 9,000 mobile doctors and nurses covering every county in the U.S., 3,500 healthcare providers and facilities in value-based arrangements, and hundreds of community-based organizations. Signify’s intelligent technology and decision-support services enable these resources to radically simplify care coordination for more than 1.5 million individuals each year while helping payers and providers more effectively implement value-based care programs.

To learn more about how we’re driving outcomes and making healthcare work better, please visit us at www.signifyhealth.com

Diversity and Inclusion are core values at Signify Health, and fostering a workplace culture reflective of that is critical to our continued success as an organization.

We are committed to equal employment opportunities for employees and job applicants in compliance with applicable law and to an environment where employees are valued for their differences.

title: DevOps Cloud Engineer, HAP Tech
description:
Description

Position at Berkeley Research Group, LLC

Job Summary

HAP Tech, a subgroup of BRG’s Healthcare Analytics practice (HAP), is one of the firm’s largest and fastest growing teams. This innovative group is currently looking for talented and dynamic professionals to join us as we continue to grow! HAP Tech supports and advises pharmaceutical manufacturers on how to navigate the challenges and complexities of the 340B program as well as other areas of the healthcare ecosystem. Our team is the established market leader in data and technology solutions for 340B-related issues and we support an impressive client base which includes the largest pharmaceutical manufacturers in the US as well as early-stage biotech companies. Beyond our syndicated solutions, we also integrate and synthesize data to deliver unparalleled analytics and insights into various aspects of the 340B program and the pharmaceutical supply chain.

The HAP Tech program is an exciting and dynamic space to be in right now, so join us!

Responsibilities

title: Software Engineering Tools DevOps Administrator - (cloud environments - TS/SC clearance)
description:
Job Description BAE Systems has a job opening for a Software Engineering Tools DevOps administrator. As a key member of the Software Engineering Tools team, the DevOps administrator will work closely with the Platform Engineering (PE) group that manages an on-premises Virtual Cloud Computing Center (VC3). The Software Engineering Tools team seeks a motivated DevOps Technical Support Administrator to tackle the task of automating reliable, sustainable, and optimized services for bringing modernized, cloud native compute technologies into closed area environments ranging from large, multi-site networks to small air-gapped environments. Your efforts on our cloud-based systems ensures application security, scalability, and reliability across multiple security enclaves to support the Software Engineering Digital Ecosystem. Your experience and passion for DevOps practices and tools will be essential in automating processes, streamlining deployments, providing disaster recovery and improving the overall efficiency of our services.



Key Responsibilities


Act as the focal point for bringing modernized, cloud native compute technologies into BAE closed area environments.Collaborate with the Platform Engineering and Closed Room Operations/Infrastructure teams to define infrastructure requirements, understand application needs, optimize system performance, scalability, and reliability.Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines for seamless application deployment and continuous integration using industry-standard tools and frameworks.Work in closed area environments to deploy tools and train administrators on support and operations activities.Automate infrastructure provisioning, configuration management, and monitoring using tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef, or similar technologies.Monitor system performance, conduct root cause analysis, and implement optimizations to enhance system availability, reliability, and efficiency.Troubleshoot and resolve production incidents related to performance, availability, infrastructure, networking, and application deployment in a timely manner.Provide close coordination with security -- ISSE’s, ISSM’s, ISSO’s -- ensuring compliance and auditability.Participate in service improvement initiatives, including identifying opportunities for service optimization and cost reduction.Stay up to date with emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices in DevOps to continuously improve the infrastructure and development processes.Work with Engineering to refine requirements into an IT plan related to modernization and DevOps needs to include modernized workloads, cloud native computing, on premise cloud, containerization, etc.Create and maintain documentation for engineering application installations and upgrades.Assist with incident response and problem management to minimize service downtime and ensure swift recovery from interruptions.Support users in a timely manner using ServiceNow Help Desk ticketing system.Ensure compliance with security and regulatory requirements. 

The Software Engineering Tools DevOps Administrator will be expected to demonstrate a high level of technical expertise, strong troubleshooting skills, attention to detail, solid leadership skills, a customer-focused attitude, a passion to learn, self-motivated and work well in teams. Flexibility in approach to finding solutions, the ability to understand and act on the customer needs and priorities and learn new technologies quickly are some of the qualities a successful candidate will have. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of delivering high-quality services in a cloud-based ecosystem and will be able to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. You will need to be comfortable working with various stakeholders, including tenants, developers, and managers, and will have strong communication and collaboration skills. The DevOps Administrator will have an understanding of cloud infrastructure and the ability to bridge between development and operations. The Software Engineering Tools team believes in investing in our professionals. Training time and opportunities are available to increase skills and keep knowledge cutting edge.



Required Education, Experience, & Skills Required Skills


Ability to obtain a Secret clearance and CompTIA Security+ or equivalent certification within 6 months of hireProven experience as a DevOps Engineer or a similar roleKnowledge of on-premises cloud infrastructure technologies, such as OpenStack, VMware, or Azure StackProficiency in scripting and automation using languages like Python, Bash, or PowerShellStrong understanding of cloud services including virtualization, containerization, and related architectural principlesFamiliarity with automation toolkits such as Ansible, Terraform, or PackerHands-on experience with CI/CD tools like GitLab and understand version control and git workflowsUnderstanding of networking concepts, TCP/IP, DNS, load balancing, and firewall configurationKnowledge of Linux/Unix systems administration and troubleshootingFamiliarity with monitoring tools and frameworks (e.g., Nagios, Prometheus, ELK stack)Working experience with Kubernetes and other containerization technologiesOccasional off-hour response to outages and subsequent service restoration effortsExcellent communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholdersStrong understanding of security and regulatory compliance requirementsDemonstrated problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work effectively in a teamExhibit sound judgement, initiative and self-motivation and able to complete tasks with minimal supervisionClose collaboration with peers, Platform Engineering, Engineering, various stakeholders and managers is essential


Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills 
Preferred 

A Security+ or equivalent certificationExperience deploying SaaS and PaaS services for use by other usersHaving a TS/SC clearanceExperience working in a customer service organization to resolve issues experienced by usersKubernetes certifications such as CKAD, CKA, or CKSConducting zero downtime Kubernetes upgradesGeneral understanding of Engineering disciplines and tools



Typical Education And Experience


Bachelor's Degree Minimum of 5 years of experience as a DevOps Engineer or similar role with on-premise cloud environments


Pay Information

Full-Time Salary Range: $112420 - $191070

Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.

Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics.


About BAE Systems, Inc.BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference.



Our Commitment To Diversity, Equity, And Inclusion


At BAE Systems, we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where employees are valued and feel like they belong. We are conscious of the need for all employees to see themselves reflected at every level of the company and know that in order to unlock the full potential of our workforce, everyone must feel confident being their best, most sincere self and be equipped to thrive. We provide impactful professional development experiences to our employees and invest in social impact partnerships to uplift communities and drive purposeful change. Here you will find significant opportunities to do meaningful work in an environment intentionally designed to be one where you will learn, grow and belong.

title: Cloud Software Engineer
description:
Job ID: 18437

The Space Dynamics Laboratory (SDL) is seeking a software engineer to become a part of our team. Our team implements an iterative software development methodology, providing solutions to our customer at regular intervals deployed to secured cloud environments. Candidates should possess experience as a software engineer working on complex multi-disciplinary systems such as cloud, distributed or enterprise software.

At SDL, we take pride in and highly value our employees. SDL offers competitive salaries and fantastic benefits, including:

Flexible work schedules that fit your style—every Friday off, every other Friday off, hybrid work, or simply traditional hours Generous paid leisure and sick leave, ensuring you never miss a special eventFavorable company locations with average commute times of less than 15 minutesHigh-quality, low-cost health, dental, and life insuranceA 14.2% employer retirement contribution into a 401(a) account—no matching required!Utah State University undergraduate tuition discounts of 50%, full reimbursement for graduate tuition, and free course audits for employees and dependents meeting eligibility requirementsA great, highly educated team that works together to solve some of the most fascinating problems on (and off) our planetWe are a growing company that maintains both a family feel and high retention rate with over 90% job satisfactionRelocation assistance available for most positions


Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, data science or engineering field5+ years of experience in software, data, or cloud systems (3+ with MS degree)Experience developing applications for one or more cloud providers with an emphasis on cloud native solutions (AWS GovCloud preferred)Applied understanding of Containerization, Virtualization and NetworkingExperience developing and deploying one or more cloud applicationsUnderstanding of software design patterns and cloud architectureUnderstanding of the application of DevSecOps principles to developmentExperience with databases and cloud data storageAbility to develop APIs and use 3rd Party APIsUnderstanding of security best practicesMust be able to work effectively independently, as part of a team, and work with partnersGood communication skills, both written and verbalUS citizenship required along with the ability to obtain and hold a U.S. Government security clearanceSome travel may be required


Desired Skills

Expertise with data lakes, data warehouse and big data tools and strategiesExperience with the AWS tech stackCloud infrastructure or platform engineering experienceDatabase, big data, data analytics or other data science experienceHave a current U.S. Government security clearance


At the Space Dynamics Laboratory (SDL), we support a variety of missions, including NASA’s vision to reveal the unknown for the benefit of humankind and the Department of Defense’s aim to protect our Nation on the ground, in the air, and in space. Our sensors, satellites, software systems, and science and engineering play an essential role in some important missions you’ve heard of, and others that you haven’t. Join our team in our seventh decade of delivering mission success.

For questions or assistance with the application process or the DoD SkillBridge program, please contact employment@sdl.usu.edu.

EOE including Disability and Vet

title: Cloud Application Software Engineer
description:
Commitment: This is a full-time, 6-month (40 hours per week) contract position staffed via HireArt. It will be onsite and available to candidates local to the Los Altos, CA area.Location ONSITE (HYBRID)Los Altos, CA

Job description
HireArt is hiring an experienced Cloud Application Software Engineer. As a cloud application software engineer, you will work on developing applications for a modern vehicle operating system, cloud applications and services, focusing on data management collected from vehicle sensors, visualizing data, and developing intelligent software workflows for next generation mobility applications.
In this role, you will be working on the cloud platform, application, and partner ecosystem, to build and support applications, designing and building supporting infrastructure services, interfaces for access, testing frameworks, and other requirements for applications operating in the cloud ecosystem.
As a Cloud Application Software Engineer, you'll:
Develop and maintain a suite of vehicle data management services.Ensure the scalability, reliability, availability, and security of the services owned by the team. Deliver on defined business problems with limited guidance and decide or influence the team's technical strategy.Lead products to improve engineering by adopting test and operational excellence best practices on the team.Influence OKRs, develop business strategy for the immediate team, and present convincingly to a wider audience.Work to improve and optimize existing cloud services to deliver business and technical value.Make recommendations for improvements and share practices broadly amongst cross-functional teams in cloud architecture development. Solve difficult and complex problems with extensible solutions. Simplify, optimize, and remove bottlenecks.Make technical trade-offs between short-term team needs and long-term business goals.

title: Oracle Cloud Functional R2R Analyst
description:

Must be highly organized, a self-starter, independent worker, innovative in solving problems, and results driven.Essential Job Functions:Full lifecycle Oracle Cloud Record to Report implementation experience in a functional rolePosition will lead the Record to Report implementation using Oracle SaaS application in the Oracle Cloud.Acceptable experience includes at least five years functional responsibility with Oracle EBS general ledger.Full lifecycle Oracle Cloud Record to Report implementation experience in a functional role.Demonstrated experience as a senior resource assisting in the definition of systems strategy, gathering and documenting business requirements, leading fit-gap analysis, as-is and to- be business process designs, conference room pilots (CRPs) functional configuration, testing, client user training. Responsibilities include, among others, managing teams in the identification of business requirements, functional design, process design (including scenario design, flow mapping), prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures.Required experience includes Oracle general ledger, financial reporting, and fixed assets.Manage and deliver components of client engagements that identify, design, and implement technology and creative business solutions for large companies.Ensures tasks are accurately scoped and conducted in line with company strategy, security, and governance guidelines.Meets regularly with internal customers (Product Owners), identifying issues and opportunities, and addressing as appropriate.Acts as a key liaison between other functional areas within IT and Business leaders throughout the Company to assess project priorities, identify opportunities for systems improvements or enhancements, and evaluate the success and impact of Financial Systems solutions on Company operations.By harnessing the power of Oracle ERP Cloud, you can streamline enterprise business processes with ERP Cloud's Financials, Procurement, or Project Portfolio ManagementGeneral Job Functions:Manage day to day interactions with executive clients and sponsors.Maintain professional, human relation, project coordination, and business management skills.Maintain excellent rapport and strong business relationships with all teammates and clients.Maintain cleanliness and orderliness of assigned work area.Understanding of corporate and business provided services of company.Ability to travel as necessary.
Competencies (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities):Excellent verbal and written communication skills across all levels of the organization, with internal and external customers.Highly motivated individual with the ability to motivate others and work collaboratively in a team of business and technical professionals.Experience using agile project management methodologies.Experience with Microsoft Project, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, Teams, and SharePoint.Experience, Educational Requirements and Certifications:Most preferred experience is Oracle Cloud.Experience in construction or AEC Industry desired.BS Degree or equivalent experience required.
Misc.: Although this position can be remote, jobholder must physically live in the United States of America.No sponsorship is available for this position.

title: Cloud Automation Engineer
description:
Location: Work is what you do, not where you go. For this role, we are open to remote work and can hire anywhere in North America

About The Opportunity

We are seeking a talented Full-Stack Developer with a strong focus on Cloud Infrastructure to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in designing, implementing, and maintaining robust, scalable, and secure solutions that support service delivery operations. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to develop and enhance our infrastructure programs, ensuring they meet the highest standards of performance, reliability, and efficiency.

What You'll Get To Do

Design and Development: Architect, design, and implement cloud-based infrastructure programs using innovative technologies and best practices. Develop and maintain scalable, high-performance backend services and APIs. Frontend Development: Create intuitive and user-friendly interfaces for managing and monitoring cloud infrastructure. Utilize modern front-end frameworks (e.g., React, Angular) to build interactive web applications. Cloud Platform Expertise: Leverage expertise in cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) to deploy, manage, and optimize infrastructure programs. Experience with Message Queueing / Caching frameworks Database Management: Design and optimize RDBMS schemas for efficient data storage and retrieval. Implement database scaling and replication strategies Experience with NoSQL databases (time series, graph, document, etc.) DevOps and Automation: Implement CI/CD pipelines for continuous integration and deployment of infrastructure programs. Automate systems and frameworks related to provisioning, configuration, and monitoring of cloud resources. Collaboration and Documentation: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, cloud engineering leaders, and other engineers to deliver high-quality solutions. Maintain comprehensive technical documentation for systems, APIs, and processes. 

Skills And Experience We Value

Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent industry experience). Hands on experience with ITIL and IaaC systems such as Universal Discovery / uCMDB, Collins, ServiceNow, Terraform, Ansible, etc. Proven experience as a Full-Stack Developer with a focus on cloud-based infrastructure programs. Proficiency in languages such as TypeScript, Python, Go, Rust, or similar. Strong knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud) and related services. Experience with containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes/AKS). Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently or in a team. Certifications in cloud platforms (e.g.,Azure Solutions Architect Expert). Experience with serverless computing and microservices architecture. Knowledge of networking principles and protocols. Familiarity with monitoring and logging tools (e.g., Prometheus, ELK stack).

title: AWS Cloud Engineer
description:
Education: · A four-year university degree or college diploma in computer science, information systems, business, or equivalent work experience in a related field.
Technical Expertise:
· At least 5-7 years of hands-on experience deploying and managing cloud infrastructure and services.· Proficiency in AWS and a deep understanding of their console and services.· Strong knowledge of infrastructure as code tools like Terraform and Azure DevOps.· Proficient in scripting languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell) for automation and task optimization.· A good understanding of cloud networking, security practices, and identity and access management (IAM).· Proficiency in cloud-based database management and administration.· Familiarity with monitoring and alerting tools for performance management and incident response.· Proven ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues efficiently.· Extensive experience with cloud platforms and services, often including AWS certifications.· In-depth understanding of security best practices, including experience with security scanning tools and the ability to architect secure systems.· Proficiency in advanced monitoring, logging, and observability tools and practices, including custom metric collection and alerting setup.· Strong knowledge of networking and system administration, including advanced troubleshooting and performance optimization.· Experience with project management, including the ability to plan and execute complex DevOps projects.

title: Sr. Manager, Change Management – Cloud Infrustructure
description:
Location: Work is what you do, not where you go. For this role, we are open to remote work and can hire anywhere in the United States or Canada

About The Opportunity

Dayforce’s Product and Technology (P&T) organization is looking for an experienced Change Management leader responsible for defining, planning, and executing the change management practice across our global Cloud Services organization. This leader will improve our existing change management frameworks, ensure compliance across both commercial and public sector environments, and create a culture of change management discipline across P&T. The ideal candidate will bring a deep background in change management, compliance, and ensure a smooth transition of services from engineering to operations while still managing risk for the business.  

What You'll Get To Do

Develop a comprehensive change management practice for the Cloud aligned with organizational goals and cloud adoption objectives. This role will mature the existing culture of change management at Dayforce. Manage the lifecycle of all changes within Cloud enabling changes to be made with minimal disruption to our customers or business using ITIL fundamentals. Facilitate the Change Advisory Board (CAB)and end-to-end change management lifecycle.  Build strong relationships with stakeholders across P&T to understand their needs, concerns, and readiness for change.Collaborate with leadership to ensure alignment and support for change initiatives. Work closely with both the Incident and Problem Management teams ensuring changes causing negative impact on our customers are prioritized. Responsible for managing the entire lifecycle of all changes and facilitating changes with minimal disruption to business operations. Ensure a smooth transition of changes from development to operations. Keep a detailed record of changes, their impacts, and outcomes is an essential aspect of transparency and accountability in change management. Effectively communicate and provide visibility to all changes and develop a comprehensive communication plan to engage with executives, stakeholders, and business users. Train, mentor, educate and guide others in change management processes and principles. Implementing training programs to foster an informed organizational culture. 

Skills And Experience We Value

7+ years’ experience leading a SaaS change management team or being a part of global change management team including working in a highly distributed organization, 24x7 availability of mission critical platforms, and regulatory scrutiny of public sector. 5+ years' experience interfacing with government regulatory agencies, including US and Canada, with the ability to communicate critical regulatory change management requirements and policies across Dayforce. Deep understanding in ITIL-based change management practices, controls, audit, and reporting. Demonstrated success with coordinating service management strategies and improving enterprise operations across organizational boundaries. In-depth knowledge of cloud infrastructure technologies for both public and private clouds. Excellent communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to interact effectively with diverse audiences. Change management certification and relevant certifications from AWS, Azure, or GCP are a bonus. Experience with ServiceNow reporting and or PowerBI reporting.

title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer (Azure )
description:
Title: Cloud Infrastructure EngineerLocation: Dallas, TexasMode of work: Hybrid
Requirements:Bachelor's degree (in Computer Science, Math, or Engineering)8+ years of experience as a full time IT professional5+ years of experience designing and supporting Azure environments, including IaaS and PaaSMicrosoft Azure Certification (MCSE: Cloud Platform and Infrastructure or equivalent)Proven experience in deploying and managing cloud based solutions in Azure Demonstrable experience with these Azure components:Azure CLI, PowerShell, and ARM TemplatesAzure Networking, Azure Virtual Networks, ExpressRoute, Site to Site VPN, NSG, App Service, Azure SQL DBAzure DevOps configuration and managementIdentity Management, Azure AD, Azure Key Vault, HSTS SSL TLS Certificate management, Azure Security Center Threat DetectionCloud monitoring Experience with Azure Log Analytics, Azure Monitor, Application InsightsAzure administration portalDemonstrable experience deploying enterprise workloads to Azure.Knowledge of at least one other cloud hosting solution in addition to Azure (e.g. Google, AWS, Helion Cloud, SoftLayer).Proficiency with PowerShell, Python, or other scripting languagesExperience designing and supporting enterprise core services as well as cloud deployments of these services.Extensive knowledge of the Microsoft Enterprise software products and servicesBusiness Continuity or Disaster Recovery planning experience, a plusDocumentation and RunBook experience is a plus

title: Cloud Architect
description: Overall 12-18 years of experience in .Net programming, ASP.NET, C#, MVC and 3+ years in Azure Cloud PaaS ServicesHands on experience in designing large scale applications with Microsoft Azure PaaS (such as Azure Storage, Azure IoT, Event Hub, Service Bus, Function, API Gateway, Azure Active Directory (AD), Cosmos DB)In-depth expertise and delivered at least one large scale Cloud solution using hybrid CDN, PaaS, IaaS, Managed PaaS, SaaS. Thorough understanding of core disciplines -compute, networking, storage, security, database architecture, Integration, Network and Content DeliveryGood understanding of Design Patterns, Microservice Architecture and API designs.Agile development environment with strong knowledge of agile processes.Good experience in developing, configuring, deploying applications using Microsoft Azure Function/Cloud App/Service FabricExperience in designing web application, REST APIs and database schemaProficient understanding of code versioning tools {{such as Git, SVN, and TFS}}Experience building and supporting an Agile DevOps environment to manage and scale multiple software productsExperience with micro services architecture and large scale application developmentPractice implementing infrastructure deployment, and configuration, as code, to deliver stable and repeatable environmentsDesign & Development Skills - .Net, MVC, Web Services, Web API's & Power shell scriptingGood understanding of distributed & multi-tenant systems.Good Communication and client facing skillsBTech/BE/MS/MCA Degree required with minimum 6 years of experience

title: Cleared Cloud Engineer On Site (3496)
description:
SMX is seeking creative technical problem solvers who can design and develop solutions with our clients. We are looking for a Cloud Engineer who has hands-on experience with using AWS technologies that support applications related to data analytics, data warehousing, and business intelligence. This person will be closely collaborating with other data analytics professionals to produce creative solutions that ensure cloud orchestration and automation capability is operating based on target SLAs with minimal downtime. This is a full-time position with on-site work performed at a client’s office located in Washington, D.C. with possibility for some flexibility to work remote. Active Top Secret clearance required.

Responsibilities

Develop cloud formation templates to build immutable infrastructure on AWSAble to work in an agile, cross-functional teamDevelop AWS lambda functions in Python or other languages for operational or business functional purposes Evaluate, respond to, and resolve AWS service issues leveraging AWS support when neededDrive technical innovation and efficiency in infrastructure operations via automation and orchestration Conduct capacity planning analysis and cloud budget planningManage the monitoring, updating, optimization, redundancy, stability of cloud systemsManage AWS services such as IAM, EC2, S3, VPC, Lambda, SNS, Cloudwatch, Redshift, RDS, Config, ECS, EKS, ALB, security groupsWork with AWS engineers on Kubernetes (EKS), ECS and Docker containersAssist other teams with provisioning and getting appropriate access to AWS resources. Work with the team to estimate the cost footprint of new AWS resources and services and conduct general forecasts for our AWS architecture. Support AWS infrastructure changes during planned maintenance windows, as well as ad-hoc support for unplanned outages. Develop system documentation for ATO 

Required Skills And Qualifications

10 years of relevant experienceDedication to innovative, sophisticated designs and collaborative problem-solvingCloud monitoring tools I.e. CloudWatch, Splunk, etc. Networking I.e. TCP/IP, DNS, etc. Application security via encryption and SSLInfrastructure as Code (IaC)AWS CloudFormationAWS ArchitectureAWS DevOps and DevelopmentTop Secret Clearance

Preferred Skills And Qualifications

2+ years of experience with AWSAWS Certification (Solutions Architect, DevOps Engineer)

#cjpost

At SMX®, we are a team of technical and domain experts dedicated to enabling your mission. From priority national security initiatives for the DoD to highly assured and compliant solutions for healthcare, we understand that digital transformation is key to your future success.

We share your vision for the future and strive to accelerate your impact on the world. We bring both cutting edge technology and an expansive view of what’s possible to every engagement. Our delivery model and unique approaches harness our deep technical and domain knowledge, providing forward-looking insights and practical solutions to power secure mission acceleration.

SMX is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability status, protected veteran status, race, color, age, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or genetic information. SMX is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer including disability and veterans.

Selected applicant will be subject to a background investigation.

title: Cloud Architect
description:
AWS/Snowflake Integration Architect - HYBRID in CHICAGO OR PEORIA, IL
W2 Contract - NO CORP TO CORP (C2C)
Position’s Contributions to Work Group:As an Architect / Engineer you will lead all stages of software development including refining product vision, gathering requirements, project planning, software system design, coding, testing, release, deployment and support. Will be optimizing and simplifying existing structures. Leading the team in adapting best practices to increase efficiency.
Typical task breakdown:1. Review the snowflake integration design - using this design to continue to build multiple use cases 2. Manage the CI/CD of snowflake changes 3. Admin the snowflake environment ( Pipe, Warehouse, user ...) 4. Automate the data quality activities in snowflake ( Task , workflow) 5. Integrate AWS - Snowflake - PowerBI - UI Apps .
Interaction with team: Team consists of 5 people in US and 20 people in India.
Work environment:Hybrid role in Chicago/Peoria office ( 3x days onsite)
Education & Experience Required: Bachelor’s degree in computer science or Electrical engineering or related field is required 10 years or more of software development experience or at least 8 years of experience with master’s degree in computer science or related field. REQUIRED: Snowflake CertificationREQUIRED: AWS Certification SA (Solutions Architect) OR Data and Analytics specialty critical
Technical Skills(Required) 3+ years Snowflake Architect level experience (Production Grade): i.e. previous titles like Data Analytics Architect or Principle Engineer5+ AWS Cloud Experience (Production Grade)3+ Implementations in snowflake and understand the advanced capabilities like ML Model deployment etc Snowflake Optimization experience (Auto clustering , Warehouse, Query plan) etc.SQL performance tuningExp with AWS well architected framework
Soft Skills(Required) Demonstrated leadership on medium to large-scale projects impacting strategic priorities.Ability to cope with shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving skills.Ability to effectively prioritize, delegate responsibilities and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.Ability to work under pressure and within time constraints Passion for technology and an eagerness to contribute to a team-oriented environment.
Disqualifiers/Red Flags:If the candidate does not have AWS experience and it is not demonstrated in the resume how they utilized AWS, they will DQ.Candidates’ current location must be on resume, if not it will be DQ not exceptions.If candidate is not currently in Chicago/Peoria area, DO NOT submit them, they will be DQ.If candidate is open to relocating on their own dime, please list that on the resume ( these candidates will not be shortlisted initially for WD review)
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to use hands and fingers, reach, climb stairs, walk, sit for prolonged periods of time, talk, and hear. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to twenty-five pounds.

title: Oracle Services - Cloud SCM Manufacturing - Manager - Tech Consulting - Open Location
description:
EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities. At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

Oracle Services – Consulting - Cloud SCM Manufacturing – Manager

The Oracle Services practice assists our national consulting practices in planning, pursuing, delivering, and managing large, complex full lifecycle initiatives along with providing experience in leading practices, methods, and resources in the Oracle applications and technology space. This group advises clients within Healthcare & Life Sciences; Energy; Advanced Manufacturing & Mobility; Private Equity; Technology, Media & Entertainment, and Technology; Consumer Products & Retail; Government & Public Sector; and Financial Services sectors. Our team looks to understand, architect, and implement the core applications and technology required to run their business. Our focus is on helping our clients to achieve the following key benefits: 

An optimal applications portfolio and governance structure that aligns with IT strategy and business architecture  Improvement in application performance driving higher customer (internal and external) satisfaction  Cost reduction and better investment decisions for applications infrastructure and services   

The opportunity

This is a rapidly growing area, so you will have plenty of opportunity to spread your wings and develop your skillset to keep up with the ever-growing demands of the digital landscape. Most of your time will be spent embedded with our clients' team and we'll look to you to provide our clients with a unique business perspective on how they must continue to innovate and remain competitive in this ever-changing industry.

Your Key Responsibilities

Our opportunity is for an experienced manager-level system implementer with expertise in Oracle Cloud Supply Chain Management applications. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in implementing Oracle Cloud solutions, specifically in the supply chain domain, and will possess industry-specific knowledge related to supply chain costing, as well as understanding the flow of manufacturing processes and data, including deep experiences with discrete, process, or contract manufacturing environments. This role is critical to our organization's efforts to optimize and streamline our clients' supply chain processes and data management.

Skills And Attributes For Success

Lead and manage the implementation of Oracle Cloud Supply Chain Management applications, ensuring successful configuration, customization, and integration to meet business requirements.Utilize your deep understanding of supply chain costing methodologies to guide the development and implementation of cost-effective supply chain solutions.Apply your industry-specific knowledge to design and optimize the flow of data and processes ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and industry best practices.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement solutions for managing external contracted manufacturing processes within the Oracle Cloud SCM system.Oversee the integration into the Oracle Cloud SCM system, enhancing visibility, control, and efficiency.Leverage your expertise in process manufacturing to enhance the Oracle Cloud SCM system's capabilities for managing complex and compliant production processes.Work closely with business stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements, ensuring that the Oracle Cloud SCM solution aligns with organizational objectives.Lead change management efforts to facilitate the adoption of new supply chain processes and systems within the Client organization.Develop and execute project plans, timelines, and budgets to ensure successful system implementations.Provide training to end-users and create comprehensive documentation for system processes and procedures.Proactively identify opportunities for process improvement and system enhancements to optimize supply chain operations. 

To qualify for the role you must have

A bachelor's degree and approximately 5-7 years of related work experience; or a graduate degree and approximately 4 years of related work experience5+ years of experience in Oracle Cloud SCM implementations.Proven track record in one or more system implementations of Oracle Supply Chain applicationsExperience with external contracted manufacturing and process manufacturing within Oracle Cloud SCM.Project management experience, including the ability to lead cross-functional teams.Proven ability to drive change and manage complex projects.The person should be able to lead and facilitate workshop sessions, work well with Offshore resources, and manage deliverablesFull lifecycle implementation experienceFamiliarity Oracle methodologies such as OUM or AIMStrong written and verbal communication, presentation, client service and technical writing skills, coupled with a strong interest in further developing and integrating enterprise business processes with technology skillsAbility and comfort level researching client inquiries and emerging issuesThe successful candidate must also be willing and able to travel up to 50% 

Ideally, you'll also have

Inventory/Materials management experienceProduct managementCost Accounting/Management experienceProduction manufacturing experienceCertified in Cloud Applications highly preferred 

What We Look For

We're interested in passionate individuals with strong vision and a desire to stay on top of trends in the Oracle Applications industry. If

What We Offer

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The salary range for this job in most geographic locations in the US is $128,400 to $235,400. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $154,100 to $267,500. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.

Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.

EY | Building a better working world

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, in accordance with applicable law.

EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities including veterans with disabilities. If you have a disability and either need assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during any part of the application process, please call 1-800-EY-HELP3, type Option 2 (HR-related inquiries) and then type Option 1 (HR Shared Services Center), which will route you to EY’s Talent Shared Services Team or email SSC Customer Support at ssc.customersupport@ey.com

title: Sales Manager, Finance Cloud
description:
About Rippling

Rippling gives businesses one place to run HR, IT, and Finance. It brings together all of the workforce systems that are normally scattered across a company, like payroll, expenses, benefits, and computers. For the first time ever, you can manage and automate every part of the employee lifecycle in a single system.

Take onboarding, for example. With Rippling, you can hire a new employee anywhere in the world and set up their payroll, corporate card, computer, benefits, and even third-party apps like Slack and Microsoft 365—all within 90 seconds.

Based in San Francisco, CA, Rippling has raised $1.2B from the world’s top investors—including Kleiner Perkins, Founders Fund, Sequoia, Greenoaks, and Bedrock—and was named one of America's best startup employers by Forbes.

About The Role

As mentioned above, Rippling has primarily been focused on HR and IT but in late 2022 we released our 3rd cloud of products - Rippling Finance Cloud. As an early leader of this team, you will lead and develop a team of Account Executives in a new organization within a fast-paced, high-growth company.

Your leadership will have a direct impact on the growth and development of your team, the sales strategy and process that will define the org, and Rippling’s success of crushing revenue goals at record breaking pace. This position reports into our Global VP of Finance Cloud in San Francisco.

What You Will Do

Manage, coach and scale a team of Account ExecutivesAssist your team throughout their strategic sales cycles by deeply understanding customers needs and mapping them to the value of RipplingMonitor sales performance: activity, pipelines, monthly forecasts, and closed-deals to ensure quota attainmentRegularly report on team and individual results through pipeline management and forecastingIdentify and make recommendations for improvement in the areas of process, efficiency and productivityLead team to achieve and exceed monthly targetsParticipate in hiring and interviewing process, as well as training and ramp-up of new team members

What You Will Need

An experienced sales manager with 2+ years of experience in managing a team for a B2B SaaS companyAble to accurately forecast team performanceMotivated with a desire to learn and have a strong work ethicExperience selling software to the CFO preferredAbility to thrive in a fast paced environment

title: Service Delivery Manager - Cloud Services
description:
Clario is a 50+ year old company that delivers industry leading clinical trial endpoint technology solutions. The future of clinical trials is vibrant, with new technologies revolutionizing what’s possible. From new trial modes to faster and integrated evidence and findings, our innovative clinical trial solutions mean we can unlock better evidence.

We are in search of a Service Delievery Manager - Cloud Services to drive and manage Cloud Services for Clario globally including AWS, Azure, Oracle Cloud. This role will work closely with Managed Services Provider (MSP) and Clario Internal teams to support the Cloud function.

What you'll do

Manage the overall IT Cloud Operations function including managing Cloud MSP (Managed Services provider), SLA/KPI management, vendor management, budget management, Cloud projects, Cloud Audits, Cloud security, Cloud Automation, Cloud deployments and provide support to business & applications that are hosted in Cloud.Establish multi cloud service support process and practice, including review and analysis of current cloud operational support processes and mapping to a future state for cloud systems support operating model; implement cloud systems support process and procedures in a multi-cloud environment.Implement or guide implementation of technology solutions for the operation ensuring consistency with overall technology standards, strategy, and operational requirements.Work effectively with stakeholders and senior leadership to manage to acceptable outcomes in line with IT cloud SOP process and procedures; record new SOP support procedures and collaborate with various teams including IT, Security, R&D, Enterprise architecture team for support, alignment, and adoption in both onshore and offshore support modelDevelop, identify, and document operational processes and procedures; assist with runbook implementations where there are gapsResponsible for the evaluation of technical risks and map out mitigation strategiesBuild and maintain a productive partnership with the MSP account team and team members.Meet daily/weekly with MSP on Network performance, ticket backlog and service improvement opportunities.Create Cloud health dashboard and review it with the leadership & Cloud stakeholders.Lead and provide technical support to junior members in the Cloud Operations teamReview and approve Cloud Infrastructure changes.Lead and execute Cloud projects to closure.Manage the Cloud budget, invoices & spend including Cloud cost reporting and chargeback process, Reserve Instance & Savings plan implementation.Develop new specs, documentation; and partake in the development of technical procedures and user support guides.Evaluate cloud applications, hardware, and software at regular intervalsDevelop and organize cloud systems and work closely with IT security to monitor the company’s cloud privacy and complianceWork on Cloud roadmap including Cloud migration & transformation and lead the migration efforts. Participate on Data Center exit project and create on-prem vs Cloud cost comparisonLead disaster recovery drills for Cloud hosted applications.Enable Cloud Security, work closely with Information security group to enhance Cloud security and implement required Cloud security tools and guardrails.Participate in Audit exercise (ISO27001, SOX, HIPAA) and enable controls per business requirements.Develop Cloud Architecture standards, guidelines, design patterns and lead new technology evaluation and deployment process.Develop Automation and Infrastructure as a Code Practice for Cloud Deployments

What we Look for

BS degree required; Computer Science, Math or Engineering degree with technical background highly desired; Advanced Degree or Cloud certificationsProfessional level certificate in AWS, Azure and other cloud platforms10+ years of IT experience in Cloud technologies including AWS/Azure/OCI, Virtualization, DevOps/AutomationMust have hands-on experience in:Cloud Infrastructure Management & OperationsCloud Migrations from on-prem to Cloud and from one Cloud to another CloudAutomation & DevOps and Infrastructure-as-a-codeCloud Network, Storage, Virtualization, Containers, Micro-services, Backup, Database, Firewalls, Security, account & platform management, Cloud Cost Management)Must have experience in managing MSP (Managed Service Provider) and Cloud/DevOps engineers.Must have experience in supporting 24x7 Cloud Operations support.Must have Cloud Cost management experience.Solid hands-on experience in ITIL and Service Management practice including ServiceNow or related ticketing tool.Expertise in Public/Private Cloud predominately in AWS/Azure/OCI/VMWAREExperience in Kubernetes & MicroservicesExperience in DevOps and Automation including Cloud Management Platform (i.e. Scalr, Flexera etc), Configuration Management tools (ie Ansible, Puppet), CI/CD & Code repo (GitLab, Azure DevOps, Jenkins etc), Infrastructure as a code including Cloud Formation, Terraform, PowerShell, Bash, PythonExpertise in supporting HA, DR, Backup and retention architectures on cloud platforms.Experience with network fundamentals such as TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, Routing, Transit gateway, Direct Connect, Express route.Experience with security fundamentals such as Endpoint, Vulnerability management, Firewall, WAF, Control tower, Guardduty, Advisor, CSPM, ISO, CIS, SOX, HIPPAExperience in Linux & Windows administrationWorking knowledge of on-prem and cloud Database technologiesAbility to create Executive Summary, Reports & Dashboard, and present presentations to Senior leadership.Ability to create operational tracker, book of work, backlog, KPI & SLA metric, Cloud health dashboard, operational process documentation & workflows using MS excel, MS PPT, MS word, Visio.Excellent verbal and written communication skillsPreferred - Any Cloud certification including AWS, Azure, Oracle Cloud

The duties and responsibilities listed in this job description represent the major responsibilities of the position. Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned, as required. Clario reserves the right to amend or change this job description to meet the needs of Clario. This job description and any attachments do not constitute or represent a contract.

The Department Head has the discretion to hire personnel with a combination of experience and education, which may vary from the above listed qualifications.

title: Senior Cloud Systems Engineer
description:
Description

Unleash your potential at Leidos, where we deliver innovative solutions through the efforts of our diverse and talented people who are dedicated to our customer’s success. We empower our teams, contribute to our communities, and operate sustainably. Everything we do is built on a commitment to do the right thing for our customers, our people, and our community. Our Mission, Vision, and Values guide the way we do business.

At Leidos, everything we do is built on our commitment to do the right thing for our customers, our employees, and our communities. Learn more about the values and culture that are the foundations of our business. Our mission is to make the world safer, healthier, and more efficient through information technology, engineering, and science. We offer a robust benefits package including competitive salaries; 401K Retirement Plan; comprehensive medical, dental and vision coverage; flexible work schedule to allow for life/work balance; tuition reimbursement and more.

Leidos is seeking highly qualified incumbent candidates for all levels of the United States Central Command (USCENTCOM) Information Technology Services (CITS) contract. You will be part of a team that provides an innovative, modernized, IT life-cycle management system to USCENTCOM, including next-generation IT infrastructure cloud services and end-to-end automation. The CITS program provides USCENTCOM with the capability to maintain high readiness rates for an innovative enterprise IT infrastructure on a global scale.

This position is for a Cloud Engineer that supports the Test, Analysis, and Integration Services PWS task area for the J66-SL Lab customer set performing Systems Engineering and Architecture functions.

Primary Responsibilities

Provides a hybrid-cloud enterprise end-state, leveraging DoD CONUS and OCONUS cloud for both classified and unclassified on-premises data centers, and tactical edge cloud computing equipment, to provide operational and business efficiencies associated with cloud technology.Provides cloud consulting services related to design, architecture, and estimate of future modernized cloud systems.Provides operations, maintenance, and enhancement of cloud applications within all USCENTCOM cloud environments.Develops cloud services strategies and provides recommendations on how to transform business solutions into using private and public cloud services.Familiarity with or expertise in one or more Cloud Service Providers.

Basic Qualifications

8+ years relevant experience with a Bachelor’s degree, or 3 years’ experience with a Master’s degree, or 9 years’ experience with an Associates’ degree, or 10 years’ experience with a High School/General Education Development diploma.The following active certifications: SRA+, or CND, or Network+, or Security+ and ITIL 4 Training, and AWS or MS Azure Certification.Must possess an active Top Secret clearance and be eligible to obtain TS/SCI clearance.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience working with the USCENTCOM customer performing enterprise IT services.

Original Posting Date

2024-04-18

While subject to change based on business needs, Leidos reasonably anticipates that this job requisition will remain open for at least 3 days with an anticipated close date of no earlier than 3 days after the original posting date as listed above.

Pay Range

Pay Range $101,400.00 - $183,300.00

The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

title: Salesforce Sales Cloud Developer
description:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, CGI, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

Salesforce Sales Cloud Developer

Position Description

The best version of us starts with You!

CGI is seeking a candidate for Salesforce Sales Cloud Developer and candidate will get an opportunity to work with highly skilled team on the newest technologies. It helps the candidate to craft the career with matured agile project delivery, sophisticated Tech stack process.

This excellent opportunity can be performed in Bloomfield, CT (Preferred), Raleigh, NC, Lafayette, LA, or Nashville, TN.

Your future duties and responsibilities

Design, develop, and implement Salesforce Sales Cloud solutions to meet business requirements.

Customize and configure Salesforce Sales Cloud features, including but not limited to: accounts, contacts, opportunities, leads, campaigns, reports, dashboards, and workflows.

Develop custom Apex code, Visualforce pages, Lightning components, and other Salesforce customizations as needed.

Integrate Salesforce Sales Cloud with other systems and applications using APIs and middleware.

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, analyze business processes, and translate them into technical solutions.

Perform unit testing, debugging, and troubleshooting of Salesforce solutions.

Stay current with Salesforce best practices, new features, and updates, and recommend ways to leverage them for business advantage.

Provide technical guidance and support to Salesforce administrators and end-users.

Document technical designs, configurations, and customizations.

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Minimum 7-8 years of experience in Salesforce development, with a focus on Sales Cloud.

4+Years of extensive working experience in Sales Cloud needed.

Proficiency in Salesforce configuration and customization, including Apex, Visualforce, Lightning components, and declarative tools (e.g., Process Builder, Flow).

Experience with Salesforce integration techniques, including REST/SOAP APIs, JSON, and middleware platforms (e.g., MuleSoft).

Strong understanding of Salesforce data model, security model, and governor limits.

Salesforce Developer certification (e.g., Salesforce Certified Platform Developer I and/or II).

Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.

Self-motivated with a strong problem-solving mindset and ability to work independently.

Experience with Agile development methodologies

Experience in Health Cloud is a plus

Education: Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field.

#DICE

CGI is required by law in some jurisdictions to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. The determination of this range includes various factors not limited to skill set, level, experience, relevant training, and licensure and certifications. To support the ability to reward for merit-based performance, CGI typically does not hire individuals at or near the top of the range for their role. Compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range for this role in the U.S. is $85,800 - 185,800.

At CGI we call our professionals "members" to reinforce that all who join our team are, as owners, empowered to participate in the challenges and rewards that come from building a world-class company. CGI's benefits include:

Competitive base salaries

Eligibility to participate in an attractive Share Purchase Plan (SPP) in which the company matches dollar-for-dollar contributions made by eligible employees, up to a maximum, for their job category

401(k) Plan and Profit Participation for eligible members

Generous holidays, vacation, and sick leave plans

Comprehensive insurance plans that include, among other benefits, medical, dental, vision, life, disability, out-of-county emergency coverage in all countries of employment;

Back-up child care, Pet insurance, a Member Assistance Program, a 529 college savings program, a personal financial management tool, lifestyle management programs and more

Together, as owners, let's turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you'll reach your full potential because...

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That's why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company's strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You'll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You'll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You'll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team-one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics.

CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S., please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at . You will need to reference the requisition number of the position in which you are interested. Your message will be routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do not include a requisition number will not be returned.

We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! Click here to be directed to our site that is dedicated to veterans and transitioning service members.

All CGI offers of employment in the U.S. are contingent upon the ability to successfully complete a background investigation. Background investigation components can vary dependent upon specific assignment and/or level of US government security clearance held.

CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI's legal duty to furnish information.

title: Director, Cloud Operations
description: Job DescriptionThe Director, Cloud Operations provides critical value to the operations of Advantive. This leader will have oversight over the strategy and management of Cloud operations inclusive of implementation, standardization, optimization and management of Engineering and Cloud infrastructure services along with leading the cloud integration of newly acquired business.The ideal candidate should have hands-on experience leading and transforming cloud operations with a focus on delivering top-tier clouds capabilities, creating state-of-the-art tooling, enabling robust cloud infrastructure solutions, and emphasizing efficiency, cost optimization, consolidating cloud footprints, compliance, and building strong relationships with both top-tier cloud services providers such as AWS and Azure, as well as next tier specialized cloud providers. Preference will be given to candidates living within proximity to Tampa, Florida, but consideration will be given to any highly qualified candidate accustomed to working within the hours of the Eastern Time Zone.Objectives and ResponsibilitiesThe primary duties of the Director, Cloud Operations consist of the following:Strategic Leadership and Vision: Align and partner with the development, IT operations and security teams, as well as the product, sales, customer success and support groups on a cloud strategy that integrates business goals, efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and complianceGuide the CloudOps team to operational excellence and continuous improvement in cloud service deliveryCloud as a Service Delivery: Manage robust, scalable, and cost-efficient Cloud as a TTV (Time-To-Value) Service offerings, focused on infrastructure, deployment and tooling. Ensure high availability, performance, security, and cost-effectiveness of the cloud infrastructureCloud as a Support: Direct and oversee cloud support for internal and external stakeholders to ensure optimal PEQs and OLA measuresManagement of cloud infrastructure, server systems, storage, virtualization/containerization and infrastructure as a code developmentEfficiency and Cost Optimization: Strategically optimize cloud resources and spending. Implement cost-saving strategies and efficient resource utilization methodologies. Provide expertise on efficiency and cost management to internal stakeholdersCompliance and Auditor Interaction: Ensure adherence to compliance standards and regulatory requirements. Actively engage with auditors, manage compliance audits, and incorporate compliance requirements into cloud operationsOwning Cloud Service Provider Relationship through 3rd Party: Build and maintain a strong relationship with AWS and Azure through a 3rd party servicing provider. Manage the partnership to leverage the best services, support, and pricing for AdvantiveCapability and Capacity Building: Develop enduring capabilities in the team through building bootcamps, training, mentoring, and hiring top talent at onsite or at offshore entities. Cultivate a culture of innovation, collaboration, technical and financial excellenceBudget Management and Financial Reporting: Oversee cloud-related budgets, conduct financial analysis, and report on efficiencies and cost savings. Implement financial controls for optimal cloud spending managementIncident Management and Compliance: Maintain robust incident management processes and ensure compliance with relevant regulations, standards and controlsBuild strategic relationships across business lines to anticipate the needs and preempt the risks encountered by company stakeholders by bridging the understanding of technical and non-technical requirements, understanding business goals, identifying business process gaps and proposing solutionsSupport disaster recovery and business continuity efforts by contributing to the development of Business Continuity PlanEnsure team cohesion and alignment through standing meeting cadence and action-oriented agendas and outcomesEstablish goals (P’s & C’s) for CloudOps department, develop team competencies and manage their performance on an ongoing basis; offer employees ongoing support and coaching to maximize team engagement and performanceTo perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following behaviors: Business Acumen: Command of fundamental elements of business operations including budget administration and forecasting, capacity planning, and data analytics Discipline and Perseverance: Focus and commitment to solving complex issues through to completion Effective Communication: Strong written and oral communication skills Excellent Time Management: a proven ability to embrace a sense of urgency to prioritize tasks Flexibility and Hard Work: Operate in a fast-paced and iterative environment while adapting to new technologies Leadership: Strong interpersonal skills, performance management, and staff interaction to inspire and lead high performance in challenging circumstances Problem-Solving: Strong critical thinking and problem-solving capabilities Quality: Dedicated to producing high-quality product deployment and hosting best practices Self-Improvement: actively self-improves through individual learning, coursework, or otherwiseTeamwork: Communicate effectively and operate collaboratively within a team environment Skills & Other RequirementsSkills & Other RequirementsMinimum of ten (10) years of relevant professional experience in IT, cloud operations or related fields including five (5) years of management experience Specific Cloud Experience: at least 5-7 years of experience should be directly related to cloud computing, such as hands-on experience with cloud services (like AWS, Azure, GCP), cloud architecture, and cloud service managementLeadership Experience: Candidates should also have substantial experience (5+ years of experience) in leadership or management roles, overseeing teams, projects, or departments related to cloud operations, IT infrastructure, or similar areasDemonstrated ability to communicate with technical and non-technical staff across multiple disciplines and hierarchical levels within the companyProven experience in a senior cloud operations role, with a focus on efficiency, cost optimization, compliance, and strong vendor relationshipsDemonstrable AWS cloud computing experience at scale, utilizing multiple AWS primitives, infrastructure as code, automation tools, and financial managementStrong planning, project management, and financial acumenDemonstrably sustained embodiment of company values involving Drive to Excellence, Grit, Humility, Integrity, Results Orientation, and Winning AttitudeBachelor’s degree in computer science or information technology discipline highly desiredDesired Competencies: Strong organizational/collaborative leadership and change management experience Highly developed written and verbal communication skills Demonstrable analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to convey and implement a vision for Cloud that will sustain the company’s immediate and long-term goalsTravel up to 10% for individuals not in the vicinity of Tampa, Florida
